talk.author: did:plc:wcmzhdguw63fmrgbaq6ztxzs
talk.utter: My mom read that the Japanese find the #4 unlucky and it's so extreme they have to no 4th floors (like our 13th floors) and they avoid the number at all costs but I find that a bit extreme.

talk.author: did:plc:hvmia6yl4ibsnu2cflddtfr5
talk.utter: It’s honestly the same as 13. Incidentally, a friend used to live on the 13th floor of their building and one time got stuck in the elevator. No one believed him when he said what floor he was stuck on

talk.author: did:plc:hvmia6yl4ibsnu2cflddtfr5
talk.utter: It’s honestly the same as 13. Incidentally, a friend used to live on the 13th floor of their building and one time got stuck in the elevator. No one believed him when he said what floor he was stuck on

talk.author: did:plc:wcmzhdguw63fmrgbaq6ztxzs
talk.utter: Wow.  I thought it was just something random and exaggerated my mom read online. I can't picture so many buildings without fourth floors.

talk.author: did:plc:hvmia6yl4ibsnu2cflddtfr5
talk.utter: I think it’s mostly hotels but tbf a lot of apartment buildings and hotels here in Canada don’t have 13th floor. It’s the same
